alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:13AM CDT until March 27 at 2:31AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting Wayne and White Counties. .A heavy rainfall event is expected to occur starting Thursday night and continuing into Friday night. Based on forecast rainfall amounts, it appears there will be some flooding on the Skillet Fork River. The degree of flooding will depend on the actual amounts that fall. The best estimate is currently minor flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
